intro: Bulbine mettinghii, commonly known as the Cape tulip, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Xanthorrhoeaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant has succulent, fleshy leaves that help it store water, adapting it to its arid environment. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal regions. Bulbine mettinghii is popular in horticulture for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
